marketNews.title: Signal from State-Owned Banks Mandated to Fund 3 Million Housing Program
marketNews.content: The Head of the Housing Task Force, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, the brother of President Prabowo Subianto, on Wednesday (2/26) signaled that the government will mandate the group of state-owned banks (Himbara) to provide financing for the planned program to construct 3 million houses per year. Hashim stated that he heard there would be an order for Himbara to support this program, with related regulations currently under discussion among decision-makers. Hashim's statement followed the request by the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, in the middle of this month, asking for an active role from Himbara to support the program to build 3 million houses per year. Besides Himbara, Erick also hoped private banks could support this program. One of the state-owned banks that has shown its readiness to support the program is Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN), with BBTN President Director, Nixon L. P. Napitupulu, stating in December 2024 that his party plans to issue bonds of approximately 10-15 trillion rupiah during 2025 to fulfill the addition of liquidity facilities for housing financing (FLPP). Nixon mentioned that the government plans to increase the FLPP quota from 220,000 housing units in 2024 to 800,000 housing units in 2025, requiring a budget of 80 trillion rupiah. It should be noted that FLPP is not only implemented by BBTN. In 2025 itself, the State Budget (APBN) allocates 18 trillion rupiah for FLPP liquidity assistance and injects working capital to PT Sarana Multigriya Finansial to channel 220,000 subsidized mortgages (KPR) with an interest rate of 5% for a 20-year tenor. Most recently, a member of the Housing Task Force, Bonny Z. Minang, stated on Thursday (2/27) that the 2025 FLPP quota has been increased to 420,000 units, with additional budget funds to be disbursed gradually. The discourse on Himbara's involvement in the 3 million houses per year program emerged amidst government efforts to increase FLPP subsidies on a larger scale through the issuance of government bonds. Although the amount of debt securities to be issued is not yet known, Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated last week that Bank Indonesia would purchase these bonds on the secondary market. Hashim claimed that Bank Indonesia has agreed to provide 130 trillion rupiah to support the program to build 3 million houses per year, although he did not specify the exact scheme Bank Indonesia will use to provide this support. Bank Indonesia previously announced an increase in the amount of KLM incentives in the housing sector - including public housing - gradually starting April 1, 2025, from 23 trillion rupiah to approximately 80 trillion rupiah. Hashim mentioned that the 3 million houses per year construction project will commence in April 2025, coinciding with the realization of an investment of about 18-20 billion US dollars from Qatari investors, Qilaa International Group. Key Takeaway: If mandated, we see that banks belonging to Himbara potentially face uncertainty regarding margins and asset quality from financing this program, especially for BBRI, BMRI, and BBNI which have not historically focused on public housing financing like BBTN. The potential margin depends on several factors such as financing interest rates, funding schemes, and cost of funds. Meanwhile, asset quality will be influenced by factors like financing schemes, tenor, and selectivity of borrower criteria. In our view, generally, this uncertainty could create negative sentiment, at least in the short term. In today's trading, Thursday (2/27), $BMRI weakened -5.28%, followed by $BBRI -4.97%, $BBTN -0.56%, and $BBNI -0.23%.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Implements Import Tariffs and Leaves Market Confused on Scope and Timing
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, stated on Wednesday (2/26) that he plans to impose a 25% import tariff on the European Union in the near future, although he did not provide further details. Trump mentioned that the tariff for the European Union would be imposed on imports of cars and all other things. It is still unknown whether the import tariff for the European Union is part of a number of previously discussed plans for tariffs on specific commodities or a separate policy targeting all products from the bloc. Previously, Trump also planned to impose a 25% tariff on imports of cars, medicines, semiconductors, and timber. Bloomberg reported that US President, Donald Trump, made contradictory and confusing statements on Wednesday (2/26) regarding the deadline and scope of several planned import tariff implementations. For example, Trump mentioned that import tariffs for Canada and Mexico would be effective starting March 4, 2025, before later stating April 2, 2025, which is the date the US Department of Commerce was supposed to announce the results of a study on reciprocal tariffs for countries hindering US trade. Bloomberg mentioned that it is unknown whether Trump will postpone the import tariffs for Canada and Mexico again or if he conflated the deadlines with other tariff plans. It is also unclear whether the tariffs for Canada and Mexico are part of the reciprocal tariff plan or a separate policy. The Head of the Legal Information Center of the Attorney General's Office, Harli Siregar, clarified on Wednesday (2/26) that the state loss of 193.7 trillion rupiah from the corruption case concerning the governance of crude oil and refinery products within the subsidiaries of PT Pertamina is an estimate for 2023 only. Therefore, Harli stated that the total loss from the corruption case occurring between 2018-2023 might still increase along with more in-depth calculation processes. Most recently, the Attorney General's Office named Maya Kusmaya (Director of PT Pertamina Patra Niaga) and Edward Corne (VP Trading of Products at PT Pertamina Patra Niaga) as new suspects in the corruption case, bringing the total number of suspects to 9 people. The Director of Investigation at the Attorney General's Office, Abdul Qohar, stated that Maya allegedly ordered Edward to blend RON 88 with RON 92 to produce RON 92 fuel products. Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Wednesday (2/26) that the government will ban crude oil exports and shorten the BBM import permit period from 1 year to 6 months, following the emergence of corruption cases within PT Pertamina subsidiaries which led to the 'adulterated Pertamax' scandal. The government will set the Reference Coal Price (HBA) 2 times a month, on the 1st and 15th, to reflect more up-to-date price conditions when used as a price reference for exporters, based on a briefing from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources on Wednesday (2/26). Currently, the HBA setting is only conducted once a month. The government itself will start mandating the HBA as an export reference price for coal starting March 1, 2025. Exporters are still permitted to use the price listed in their ongoing long-term contracts with buyers, but the government expects companies to make adjustments if their contracts allow it. The advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Wednesday (2/26) that the government ensures there will be no tax increases, with efforts to increase state revenue being carried out by optimizing revenue from the shadow economy activities. Hashim, as a businessman, admitted that he wants the corporate income tax rate or PPh Badan to decrease from 22% to 18%, a desire he conveyed directly to the Deputy Minister of Finance, Anggito Abimanyu, on the same occasion. Previously, President Prabowo promised during his election campaign to raise the state revenue ratio to 23% of GDP, much higher than the 2025 APBN target of around 12% of GDP. President Prabowo Subianto secured plans for the establishment of the State Revenue Agency through Presidential Regulation Number 12/2025 concerning the National Medium-Term Development Plan (RPJMN) for the 2025-2029 period. This agency is intended to boost the state revenue ratio to the 23% of GDP level. The establishment of the State Revenue Agency was one of President Prabowo's campaign promises but was canceled following Sri Mulyani's return as Minister of Finance. The advisor and brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Wednesday (2/26) that the government plans to achieve budget efficiency of around 20 billion US dollars or approximately 328 trillion rupiah every year, where the funds resulting from budget cuts will most likely be invested in the Danantara Investment Management Agency. Previously, President Prabowo mentioned that the government would allocate initial funds to Danantara amounting to 20 billion US dollars from this year's budget efficiency savings. Petrosea ($PTRO) signed a mining services contract worth approximately 4 trillion rupiah from PT Bara Prima Mandiri and PT Niaga Jasa Dunia, both non-affiliated companies. The contract is a follow-up to the term sheet announced in November 2024. The contract duration will last until December 31, 2032, with estimated overburden production reaching ~135.5 million bcm and coal production of ~7.5 million tons.

tickerNews.title: $ASII 2024: Exceeds Expectations, Proposes Final Dividend of Rp308/Share
tickerNews.content: Astra International ($ASII) recorded net profit of 8.2 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+1% YoY, -18% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 34 trillion rupiah (+1% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equals 106% of the consensus estimate. Financial services segment and profit from associate entities and JVs were the main supporters of the net profit performance in 4Q24. Financial services segment operating profit grew +11% YoY and +4% QoQ, while profit from associate entities and JVs grew +13% YoY despite dropping -8% QoQ. Tax expense was also a driver of net profit, as this expense decreased -9% YoY in 4Q24 and -3% YoY during 2024. ASII management stated that the company proposes a final dividend of 308 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 6.7% based on the stock price on Thursday (2/27) at 4,590 rupiah.

tickerNews.title: $UNTR 2024: Net profit of 19.5 trillion rupiah, fulfilling consensus estimates
tickerNews.content: United Tractors ($UNTR) recorded net profit of 3.9 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-35% QoQ, -25% YoY). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach 19.5 trillion rupiah (-5.2% YoY), equal to 101% of the consensus estimate. In terms of top-line, revenue in 4Q24 reached 34.9 trillion rupiah (-0.5% QoQ, +13% YoY), so that revenue during 2024 grew +4.5% YoY to 134 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: $ITMG 2024: Net profit of 374 million USD, in line with expectations
tickerNews.content: Indo Tambangraya Megah ($ITMG) recorded net profit of 101 million US dollars in 4Q24 (-29.8% QoQ, +7% YoY). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 374 million US dollars (-25.2% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 101.7%/101.6% of Stockbit/consensus estimates. Quarterly, revenue (+6.5% QoQ) grew along with an increase in sales volume (+9.5% QoQ) amidst a decrease in Average Selling Price (ASP) of -3.1% QoQ. On the cost of revenue side, the decrease in mining costs (-6.6% QoQ) and coal purchase costs (-17.2% QoQ) caused the gross profit margin to rise to 35% (vs. 3Q24: 33.6%). The quarterly drop in net profit was caused by other income turning into a loss of 31 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: profit of 32 million US dollars) due to exchange rate losses.

tickerNews.title: $ADMR: $ADRO increases ownership to ~84.1% after purchasing 109 million shares
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO), the controller of Adaro Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR), purchased 109 million shares of $ADMR at an average price of 965 rupiah per share on February 21, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 105.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, ADRO's ownership in $ADMR increased from ~83.8% to ~84.1%.

tickerNews.title: $BBCA: Two directors purchased shares, increasing long-term ownership stakes
tickerNews.content: Two directors of Bank Central Asia ($BBCA), John Kosasih and Santoso, each purchased 45,000 and 20,000 $BBCA shares at an average price of 8,875 rupiah per share and 8,900 rupiah per share respectively on February 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 400 million rupiah and 178 million rupiah, respectively. After this transaction, John's and Santoso's ownership in $BBCA increased, but they remain at around 0.001% and 0.002% respectively.

tickerNews.title: $LABA: Plans to acquire 45% stake in PT Gotion Indonesia Materials to expand into nickel mining
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group ($LABA) announced plans to purchase a 45% stake in PT Gotion Indonesia Materials for an undisclosed amount from PT Neopower Teknologi Indonesia. This planned transaction aims to increase the company's profitability and broaden its upstream to downstream activities in the new and renewable energy industry, considering that PT Gotion Indonesia Materials holds a nickel mining business permit.

tickerNews.title: $HRUM: Commissioner Lawrence Barki purchased ~6.2 million shares, resulting in 0.046% ownership
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy ($HRUM) Commissioner, Lawrence Barki, purchased approximately 6.2 million $HRUM shares at an average price of approximately 788 rupiah per share on February 24-25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Lawrence Barki's ownership in $HRUM increased from none previously to 0.046%.

tickerNews.title: $PTSN: Selected to supply batteries for Apple's AirTag production in Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated that Sat Nusapersada ($PTSN) will be the local company selected to supply battery components for the production of Apple Inc.'s (Nasdaq: AAPL) AirTag in Indonesia. The development of the 150 million US dollar AirTag factory will be carried out by Apple's partner, Luxshare Precision Industry Co. Ltd. (SHE: 002475). Agus claimed that the factory to be built in Batam will supply 65% of the global AirTag demand, with quite high export potential. Besides the construction of the AirTag factory, Apple also committed to investing 160 million US dollars in cash for innovation, research, and development facilities in Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: $EMTK: CEO Alvin W. Sariaatmadja increased stake to 1.5% after purchasing ~825 million shares
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK) President Director, Alvin W. Sariaatmadja, purchased approximately 825 million $EMTK shares at an average price of 400 rupiah per share on February 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 330 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Alvin W. Sariaatmadja's ownership in $EMTK increased from 0.16% to 1.5%. This is part of the $EMTK share transaction in the negotiated market previously reported in Stockbit Snips on Monday (2/24).

tickerNews.title: $PNBN 2024: 4Q24 net profit surges +373% YoY due to lower provisioning burden
tickerNews.content: Bank Pan Indonesia ($PNBN) recorded net profit of 550 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+373% YoY, -40% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 reaching 2.7 trillion rupiah (+8.1% YoY). The annual surge in net profit in 4Q24 was caused by a decrease in provisioning expense to 780 billion rupiah (-37% YoY, +641% QoQ). This result led to the provisioning expense for 2024 decreasing by -39% YoY to 1.7 trillion rupiah. On the top-line side, Net Interest Income (NII) was recorded to increase to 2.2 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+2.1% YoY, +1.9% QoQ), although NII during 2024 decreased by -3.6% YoY.

tickerNews.title: $CNMA 2024: Net profit of 729 billion rupiah (+6% YoY), below expectations
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sejahtera Raya ($CNMA) recorded net profit of 199 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-34% YoY, +42% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 2024 reach 729 billion rupiah (+6% YoY), below expectations as it only equals 85% of the consensus estimate. The annual decline in net profit in 4Q24 was due to a surge in operating expenses (+17% YoY, +3% QoQ), causing the operating profit margin to drop to 20% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 30%, 3Q24: 16%). Meanwhile, revenue in 4Q24 grew flat (+1.3% YoY, +9.1% QoQ), bringing revenue during 2024 to 5.7 trillion rupiah (+9.2% YoY) and representing 92% of the consensus estimate. Operationally, the number of viewers during 2024 grew +3.4% YoY to 87 million with an average ticket price increasing by +8.1% YoY to 44,720 rupiah, although the occupancy rate decreased to 23.9% (vs. 2023: 27%). CNMA management stated in the earnings call on Thursday (2/27) that the company targets the opening of 50-60 new screens during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 70 new screens).
